parameters.name: Mary Elizabeth McGlynn

bdy.p:
Mary Elizabeth McGlynn (born October 16, 1966) is an American voice actress, ADR director, writer and singer best known for her extensive
English-language dubbing of various anime, and her singing in
Silent Hill 3
, , and Dance Dance Revolution EXTREME. She provided vocals for some music tracks in the movie adaptation of
Silent Hill . She has also had several movie roles. She is currently married to
Daran Norris . Mary was a counselor at the Interlochen Arts Camp in Intelochen, Michigan.

sec.p:
Mary Elizabeth McGlynn has also been credited as Melissa Williamson and Anna Top. She has been the English counterpart of
Atsuko Tanaka three times: both of them have played Jagura in Wolf's Rain, Rosso the Crimson in Dirge of Cerberus - Final Fantasy VII - and
Motoko Kusanagi
in the Ghost in the Shell series. She was a Guest of Honor at
Anime Expo 2007,
Long Beach , and won the 2007 American Anime Award for Best Female Voice Actress for her role as Major
Motoko Kusanagi
in .

- Evil Rose, Noble Rose (uncredited)
Walker, Texas Ranger — Merilee Summers, "Right Man Wrong Time"
Star Trek Voyager — Daelen, " Vis à Vis"
Quantum Leap — Sue Anne Winters, "Memphis Melody"
Xena Warrior Princess — Pandora, "Cradle of Hope"
Dance Dance Revolution EXTREME — "You're Not Here" (credited as Heather) and "Your Rain (Rage Mix)"

Silent Hill 3
— "Lost Carol", "I Want Love", "Letter - From the Lost Days" and "You're Not Here" (as Melissa Williamson)
— "Waiting for You", "Room of Angel", "Tender Sugar", and "Your Rain"
Silent Hill (2006 movie) — "Letter - From the Lost Days", "Lost Carol", and "You're Not Here" (from Silent Hill 3), and "Waiting for You" (from Silent Hill 4: The Room).
— "Blow Back", "Shot Down In Flames", "O.R.T." and "Hole In The Sky" (as Mary Elizabeth)

entry.it: Silent Hill Homecoming — "One more soul to the call", "Theme of Alex", "Theme of Elle" and "The sacred line"
